00028 Category::Category()
00029 {
00030 }
00031 
00032 Category::Category(string _name, int _code)
00033 {
00034         name = _name;
00035         code = _code;
00036         
00037         //Initialize the XML Element TransactionXML
00038         CategoryXML     = new TiXmlElement( "cat" );
00039         
00040         //set the xml portion.
00041         setXML();
00042 }
00043 
00044 Category::Category(TiXmlElement * parent)
00045 {
00046 
00047         name = parent->Attribute("name");
00048         code = atoi( parent->Attribute("code") );
00049         
00050         CategoryXML = parent;
00051 }

00053 
00054 /* recursivly lists all categories and indents them
00055  * based on parent child relationships
00056  */
00057 void Category::listCategory(int indent)
00058 {
00059 cout<<"#####################################"
00060         <<"Categories \n";
00061         string indent_tabs;
00062         
00063         for (int i= 0; i < indent; i++)
00064         {
00065                 indent_tabs += '\t';
00066         }
00067 
00068         int counter_base = 0;
00069         
00070         TiXmlNode* pElem = (TiXmlNode*) CategoryXML;
00071         for ( pElem; pElem; pElem=pElem->NextSiblingElement() )
00072         {
00073                 //set up the tabs and counter.  Then print the catagory.
00074                 cout << indent_tabs << counter_base << ": " ;
00075                 
00076                 //create the tmp object and print the tmp category.
00077                 Category tmp( (TiXmlElement*)pElem );
00078                 tmp.print() ;
00079                 
00080                 TiXmlNode* pElem_child = pElem->FirstChildElement( "cat" );
00081                 if ( pElem_child )
00082                 {
00083                         Category child( (TiXmlElement*)pElem_child );
00084                         child.listCategory(indent + 1);
00085                         
00086                 }
00087                 counter_base++;
00088         }
00089 
00090 }
00091 
00092 /* prints out the variables only if the size is zero.  Otherwise it
00093  * calls the list again if the vector is full.
00094  */
00095 void Category::print()
00096 {
00097         cout << "Category\tname \"" << name << "\"\t code \"" << code << "\"" << endl;
00098         
00099 }

00101 
00102 /* adds a category to be a sibling of the main
00103  * category element;
00104  */
00105 void Category::addCategory(Category child)
00106 {
00107         CategoryXML->LinkEndChild( child.getXML() );
00108 }
00109 
00110 
00111 /* adds a subcategory to be a child of another categories
00112  * category element;
00113  */
00114 void Category::addSubCategory(Category parent, Category child)
00115 {
00116         
00117         TiXmlNode* pElem = (TiXmlNode*) CategoryXML;
00118         for ( pElem; pElem; pElem=pElem->NextSiblingElement() )
00119         {
00120                 TiXmlNode* pElem_child = pElem->FirstChildElement( "cat" );
00121                 Category current( (TiXmlElement*)pElem );
00122                 if ( catcmp( current, parent) )
00123                 {
00124                         current.addCategory( child );
00125                         return;
00126                         
00127                 }
00128                 
00129                 if ( pElem_child )
00130                 {
00131                         //Category new_child( pElem_child.ToElement() ) ;
00132                         //new_child.addSubCategory(parent, child) ;
00133                         
00134                         Category child_cat( (TiXmlElement*)pElem_child );
00135                         child_cat.addSubCategory(parent, child);
00136                 }
00137         }
00138         
00139 }

00142 /* Set the XML attributes for the node */
00143 void Category::setXML()
00144 {
00145 /*      //Sample category end product code.
00146 *       <cat name="all" code="0">
00147 *               <cat name="Auto" code="1">
00148 *                       <cat name="Fuel" code="12"></cat>
00149 *                       <cat name="Insurance" code="13"></cat>
00150 *                       <cat name="Registration" code="14"></cat>
00151 *                       <cat name="Maintenance" code="15"></cat>
00152 *                       <cat name="Car Payment" code="16"></cat>
00153 *               </cat>
00154 *               <ciop90-at name="Food" code="4">
00155 *               </cat>
00156 *               <cat name="Income" code="5">
00157 *               </cat>
00158 *               <cat name="Savings" code="6">
00159 *               </cat>
00160 *       </cat>
00161 */
00162 
00163         CategoryXML->SetAttribute("name", name);
00164         CategoryXML->SetAttribute("code", code);        
00165 
00166 }
00167 
00168 /* Get the xml element from the category object
00169  */
00170 TiXmlElement *  Category::getXML(){
00171         return CategoryXML;
00172 }
00173 
00174 
00175 /* compare two categories using their name and code
00176  * this does not check for the XML to be the same.
00177  */
00178 bool Category::catcmp(Category c_one, Category c_two)
00179 {
00180 
00181         if ( c_one.name == c_two.name && c_one.code == c_two.code )
00182         {
00183                 return true;
00184         }
00185         else
00186         {
00187                 return false;
00188         }       
00189                 
00190 }
